transportAdvice: Funchal is partially walkable in its central areas, though the hilly terrain makes some neighborhoods challenging on foot; cable cars serve key tourist routes. A public bus network covers the city and wider island, and taxis are widely available for reaching attractions beyond walking distance.

weather.description: Mild and occasionally rainy, with cool evenings; one of the wetter months but still pleasant for sightseeing.
Similar to January with mild temperatures and periodic rain showers; the famous Carnival celebrations brighten the month.
Gradually warming with a mix of sunshine and showers; the Flower Festival typically takes place around this time.
Pleasantly warm and increasingly sunny, making it a great month for hiking and outdoor exploration.
Warm and mostly dry with comfortable temperatures; ideal conditions for levada walks and coastal activities.
Early summer brings reliable sunshine and warm days; a popular time to visit with long daylight hours.
Hot and sunny with very little rain; the busiest tourist season with lively outdoor dining and beach visits.
The warmest month of the year with abundant sunshine; expect crowds and warm sea temperatures.
Still warm and largely sunny as summer winds down; a pleasant month with slightly fewer tourists.
Temperatures begin to ease and rain becomes more frequent; still enjoyable for outdoor activities.
Noticeably cooler with increasing cloud cover and rain; a quieter period good for budget-conscious travelers.
Mild winter conditions with occasional rain; Funchal's famous New Year's Eve fireworks draw visitors from around the world.
